data.text:
#DidYouKnow that since we painted one of our A220-300 in the motives of Estonian flag, it has performed 2060 flights, carrying the symbol and the name of its capital across the world! 
Happy Independence Day, Estonia! 🇪🇪

📸 by Vilnius Airport https://t.co/ETbDWK0R7p

data.text: A bit more than a half (52%) chose the right answer! 😊 The Technical Department is the second-largest and ensures that the aircraft are properly maintained. Any guesses for the largest department? 🤔
It’s #airBalticQuiz time! This week we introduced you with our technician Oskars from the technical department. 🔧 Can you guess whether this department at airBaltic is:

With our new codeshare partner @lufthansa, we are offering convenient access to a worldwide network. Tickets via Frankfurt and Munich to many cities in Germany and other European countries are available on @airBaltic website.
✈️ See the options here: https://t.co/eLg5lfhyxR https://t.co/4b1s9eOLIl

data.text: We deliver. We care. We grow. These are the core values that we stand for. They serve as our compass and guide all of our actions, behaviors and decision-making process every day. Learn more of what lies at the heart of our brand: https://t.co/Nkmz2SYQUS https://t.co/8TJQEwGLSc

#DidYouKnow that the 'Flight turnaround' starts when the aircraft arrives at a terminal gate and end when it departs from the gate. Speed, efficiency, and accuracy are the most important aspects in the ground-handling process, with the main focus being on flight safety! https://t.co/pE7PCazlrC

We spent a day with our composite technician Oskars. Watch the video to find out why he’s called the microsurgeon of aviation! Learn more about our technical department: https://t.co/4bT0t3bFY5 https://t.co/lPWYw7pESm

We're happy to announce a codeshare agreement between @lufthansa and @airBaltic. Our customers will benefit from convenient access to a worldwide network, while Lufthansa passengers will have more possibilities to travel from Munich to the Baltic states. https://t.co/jdpHCReMWP https://t.co/YPWpN0GtjB

data.text:
While continuing to maintain essential connectivity to and from the Baltic region, this week @airBaltic plans to perform flights from Riga to 14 different destinations. 
✈️ See where we'll fly: https://t.co/q62kXDqmcB https://t.co/T8TKyVGdYx

Thanks for participating! Looks like most of you (36%) would prefer a hike in the mountains but for many (33%) enjoying a delicious pizza in Rome would also be a choice for a romantic getaway. 🤗 We hope you had a lovely weekend! 💗

data.text: We have to confess - you truly make our hearts dance! Wishing you to always find love in everything that you do - happy Valentine’s Day from all of us at @airBaltic 💚 https://t.co/zitKpb2TKw
Doing what we love each day 💚 https://t.co/ju82qxSpeh

Love is ... making plans together 💚 This Valentine's Day, give your loved one @airBaltic gift card and plan your romantic getaway together for when you are ready to fly again. It can be used within one year for booking any flight: https://t.co/RyU9qeKsop https://t.co/VpcU5aOVo4

Valentine’s Day is just around the corner, love is in the air and it’s time for #airBalticQuiz! 💕
Imagine – you have the opportunity to visit one of these destinations for the romantic getaway. What would you choose?

In 2020, we've handled more than 997 000 passenger inquiries made via call centre, e-mail and social media, which is 26% more than in the previous year. Read more: https://t.co/UWAVZdjgde https://t.co/CP2WMbwrLs

#DidYouKnow that aircraft do not fly in ‘straight lines’ from point A to B. Different routes are being planned and trajectory mainly depends on airspace restrictions, regulations, wind, en-route weather and air navigation charges.
📸 by Lukasz Zak https://t.co/8tmHWtT3WG

data.text: It’s #ThrowbackThursday! Did you know that on this day 11 years ago we carried a self-portrait of Leonardo Da Vinci on its first-ever flight from Rome via Riga to Tallinn? This happened 500 years after the artist first sketched his aircraft models! https://t.co/IgBRHTVF7u

entity.name: Celebrating Leonardo da Vinci on the 500th anniversary of his death
entity.description: The artist, scientist and inventor who is widely regarded as a Renaissance genius died in France on May 2, 1519.

domain.description: News Categories like Entertainment or Technology

domain.name: Reoccurring Trends
domain.description: Twitter generated Trends that occur on a daily, weekly, monthly, or yearly basis such as Monday motivation.

data.text:
Another Wednesday with some facts! #DidYouKnow that last year we carried 195 000 passengers in Lithuania and 225 000 passengers in Estonia? We ensured the essential connection between the Baltics and Europe!
📷 by Kobi Ben Navi https://t.co/w7kUNsKFE0

We have achieved some very important targets on our way to becoming a more sustainable airline. Visit our new sustainability site where you can read more about our sustainability goals and efforts towards greener skies: https://t.co/ndbvDSxcdf https://t.co/zGoVRcCrPo

What else do we carry apart of our lovely passengers? 💚 In 2020, we carried 7.5 million kilograms of mail and cargo on our aircraft fleet. The demand for air freight per flight increased, and we were proud to maintain our status as the largest cargo operator at @riga_airport. https://t.co/A2wkGjurXr

Hello! 👋 Results for the #airBalticQuiz are in! This time only 27% of you clicked the right answer - Stockholm and London.
As of today the newest February/March issue of our Baltic Outlook inflight magazine is out! Check it out here: https://t.co/qSid5usLt7

It's not that easy to travel these days - entry rules in each country are different and subject to change on a short notice. To make this easier for you, we offer a special widget with all the latest details!
Try it now: https://t.co/CJ45i0ZUDs https://t.co/nTeMqxeP4j

data.text: According to @riga_airport, in 2020 @airBaltic has maintained its market leader position, by carrying 57% of all passengers to the Latvian capital. In 2020, we carried 1.14 million passengers to and from Riga. Read more: https://t.co/aXS30fo16u https://t.co/roUxpaGHKF

Are you ready for weekly #airBalticQuiz? 🤓 Our inflight magazine Baltic Outlook is full of surprises and useful tips. Can you guess which were the 'cities of the month', included in the last issue of the magazine? 📰

Think green, fly green 💚 While we wait for air travel to reclaim its place in our lives, we continue to work on our sustainability initiatives. Visit our new sustainability site where you can read more about @airBaltic efforts toward greener skies: https://t.co/jlQTU4GGUj https://t.co/4eoMiIc3sa

data.text: #DidYouKnow that 14 of our Airbus A220-300 fleet planes are named after Latvian cities and towns in honour of Latvia's centenary? They were chosen by public in online voting which took place in the autumn of 2018! https://t.co/QbvLxKJHAV

We have established and received certification of our brand-new Maintenance Training Organization that, being a part of airBaltic Training, will provide training and certification for aircraft technicians. Read more: https://t.co/9WrTbEKkG3 https://t.co/BHQaClvlAf
Thanks for participating! Most of you (75%) absolutely prefer to enjoy the views outside during the flight. Let's hope 2021 will bring more of these magical moments! ✨ https://t.co/JEA8mlOl89
Hello, Friday and hello #airBalticQuiz! One of the many perks of flying is astonishing and surprising views outside the window. However, we would love to know - do you prefer:

Since the first C check in 2019, we have continued our maintenance program, completing a full scope of maintenance on seven @Airbus A220-300 aircraft. C check is an important part of any airline operation, ensuring that aircraft meets highest safety and efficiency standards. https://t.co/2pFrK6snvr
#DidYouKnow that you do not need a key to start a plane? In our Airbus A220-300 everything is done with a combination of buttons and switches. https://t.co/F8xOZe7lQv

Thank you for taking part in our quiz! Majority of you (70%) got the right answer - the coldest airport in the world is Yakutsk Airport in Russia, with temperatures regularly reaching -40˚C during the winter! ❄️

Temperature here in Latvia is now dropping way below 0°C. 🥶 Grab your warm tea and sit down for this week's #airBalticQuiz! Can you guess which airport is officially the world's most coldest, according to various sources?

data.text:
#DidYouKnow that in freezing conditions, a special process called 'de-icing' is being done to the aircraft? It is process of removing snow, ice or frost from the plane's surface. This also prevents ice formation on flight surfaces during take-off.
📸 Ilya Tomkovich https://t.co/WU3R2f5PIV

airBaltic atgādina, ka, sākot ar 15. janvāri, visiem pasažieriem ar lidojuma galamērķi Latvijas Republikā būs jāuzrāda apliecinājums par negatīvu Covid-19 testu, kas veikts ne ilgāk kā pirms 72 stundām. Sīkāk: https://t.co/3KXTamUyug https://t.co/hMxlgkddbR

airBaltic reminds its passengers that starting of January 15, all travelers with their final destination in the Republic of Latvia need to have a negative Covid-19 test result that is not older than 72 hours upon entry into the country. Read more: https://t.co/0qwWSFe1vS https://t.co/Bi5IWPoSqI

Our air filter removes 99.99% of all particles as small as bacteria and viruses and supplies a complete exchange of fresh air every 2-3 minutes. Read more: https://t.co/Oh2lbNYtEX https://t.co/gmXYXVDPfV

Thank you for participating in our first quiz of the year! 🎉 Most of you are seeking to travel more and experience all of the perks of doing so. 🤗 Visit our webpage https://t.co/Zibba9Nx4A to catch some inspiration for your next vacation!

urls.title: Cheap flights to Baltics, Europe & Middle East | airBaltic
urls.description: Buy cheap flights to the Baltics, Middle East and Europe online today from airBaltic. We fly to 70+ destinations from Riga, Vilnius and Tallinn.

data.text: Last year, we've carried 73% less passengers than the year before. 2020 will go in history as the toughest year commercial aviation has yet seen. Read more of @airBaltic past year's results: https://t.co/kevAf4pxFx https://t.co/oR4vpL4AzQ
First week of 2021 is coming to an end and it’s time for this year’s first #airBalticQuiz! Let’s start the year by setting some goals. In 2021 I wish to:

We are truly proud to be the first airline to receive the highest Skytrax COVID-19 Safety Rating. This rating reflects our commitment to provide safe travels during the pandemic, following various hygiene and safety procedures. Read more: https://t.co/i1ETuPFdCQ https://t.co/3i1SnipfZg

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

data.text: Safety is our top priority! #DidYouKnow that inside the passenger cabin, the airflow is supplied from above the overhead compartment and flows directed towards the floor, eliminating airflow along the cabin and minimising lateral air transmission among passenger rows? https://t.co/hcrSXeY8oL
Very proud to be ranked among world’s TOP20 for COVID-19 compliant airlines by @Airline_ratings. Read the full article here: https://t.co/070yISgQai https://t.co/aNfcjCD26i
Ladies and gentlemen, we have taken off for a new year and new adventures! Who’s coming with us? 📷by Roberts Epners https://t.co/DCvhl7OMMt

data.text: Happy New Year, travelers! We wish 2021 to be an amazing year full happiness, new opportunities and heartwarming memories! Let’s meet in the skies again this year! ✈️ https://t.co/Z1oxNBn8P3

data.text: #DidYouKnow that since October 2020 airBaltic has launched the Sustainability Development Goals calendar. Each month we will highlight and contribute to resolving issues related to specific sustainable development goals (SDGs). https://t.co/SqYQm9I6rb

These days we're celebrating the end of 2020 and hoping for a better 2021. We're curious to hear - is your desire for traveling still alive?

If 2021 becomes the year of travel, you will...
🎄May the Holiday spirit fly high across the world! Wishing you all a season filled with joy, peace, and happiness! https://t.co/Pgb1X7AAm9

#DidYouKnow that in the spirit of Christmas plays, in 2016 we created a special performance - the first ever ballet performed by an airplane from the world famous “The Nutcracker”! https://t.co/ExJU2ca9Cf

data.text: After nearly two decades of operations in our fleet, we are saying goodbye to Boeing 737 aircraft. We thank the Boeing fleet for the journey full of incredible milestones and 17 outstanding years of connecting passengers all across @airBaltic network. https://t.co/a6kDeouDBd

data.text: Path on becoming even greener! #DidYouKnow that since October all our onboard lists are digital? It saves approximately 5kg of paper per day, 150 kg per month, 1.8 tonnes per year! Our Cabin Crew is not carrying long paper lists anymore, instead receiving all the data digitally. https://t.co/iU8vHbfGhL

We are ensuring the essential connectivity also this winter season! During December and January, we plan to perform over 2500 flights on over 45 routes from all Baltic countries. In December, the most popular destinations are Amsterdam, Oslo and London. https://t.co/EmSbclHtXW https://t.co/BYGPMZPdTE

data.text: An early holiday present for @airBaltic! 🎁 We have welcomed our 24th and 25th @Airbus A220-300 aircraft, registered as YL-AAX and YL-AAY. These two jets complete the planned new aircraft deliveries for airBaltic in 2020. https://t.co/Wy41yc4GJm
This week we published our flight schedule for summer season 2021! ☀️ In this #airBalticQuiz we would like to know your thoughts – which season makes you most excited for travelling?

data.text:
We have published our flight schedule for the upcoming Summer season that will begin on March 28, 2021. We plan to connect Riga with 65 destinations across our network, and to launch five new routes. 
✈️ Read more: https://t.co/vNHvU86ta9 https://t.co/wKs34BRAHh

#DidYouKnow that during the flight pilot duties are divided as Pilot Monitoring (PM) and Pilot Flying (PF)? While PF is generally responsible for aircraft maneuvering, PM takes care of communication, documentation and assists PF. https://t.co/KoiACrDAjO
Our CEO @Gaussm will be sharing his thoughts and insights on the outlook for 2021 at @CAPA_Aviation’s #CAPALive. Register here: https://t.co/YZBu4jo9Ki https://t.co/LDwYKzP816

Good morning! ☀️ This time more than a half of you picked the right answer - our first @Airbus A220-300 aircraft began its commercial operations on December 14th, 2016 with a flight from Riga to Amsterdam. Have a wonderful week! 🤗

We're happy to announce @airBaltic Calendar of 2021 is available for purchase! As its title – wings for the new beginnings – suggests, we expect that 2021 will mark a new beginning in aviation: clean, green, and as full of passion as ever. 
💚 Get yours: https://t.co/WLeLJ94aUj https://t.co/aFnjHjQ7ef

Hurray to Friday and another #airBalticQuiz! 🤩 This week we celebrated four years since receiving our first A220-300 aircraft. Do you know the destination of our first commercial flight performed by this aircraft? ✈️
Pilots never stop learning! #DidYouKnow that pilots undergo simulator training every 6 months to improve and refresh their knowledge in non-standard situations? https://t.co/edu79Btpyv

Great news for passengers traveling between Vilnius and Kyiv! We have launched direct flights between the two cities, and the new flights will be performed two times a week on Airbus A220-300 aircraft. Read more: https://t.co/zqyozaDkM3 https://t.co/TmvNhN3JXE

Today we're celebrating four years since the beginning of @airbaltic @Airbus A220-300 fleet. On November 30, 2016, we received our first aircraft of this type, registered as YL-CSA! ✈️
When was your first flight with A220-300? https://t.co/KolK46hopM

Thanks for participating in the quiz! Majority of you were right! Although winglets reduce turbulence and drag, they also improve aircraft’s fuel efficiency! And look amazing, don’t they? 😎 https://t.co/xaaFoxnLiE

Time for our weekly #airBalticQuiz! Let’s explore the technical side of aviation. 🔧 The tips of airplane wings used to be straight. Can you guess - why the tips of the wings nowadays are curved upwards? ✈️
#DidYouKnow that silver stripes on the cabin crew jackets represent their rank? Senior cabin crew wear one line, while cabin crew team leaders and instructors wear two lines. https://t.co/AUcfdFEJ6l

data.text: Thank you for participating! Most of you - more than a half (62%) tapped the right answer. Optimal cruising altitude for our Airbus A220 is between 10 and 12 km. Have a wonderful week! ☀️

Weekend is approaching and it’s #airBalticQuiz time! Did you know that the cruising altitude is one of the most crucial factors of aircraft's fuel efficiency?🤔Can you guess the optimal cruising altitude for our Airbus A220?

#DidYouKnow that our aircraft with Latvian national flag during these two years have already performed 2599 flights? It has brought the Latvian national symbol to 70 destinations! https://t.co/PPSG19cPQZ
If there's one thing that makes us really happy and proud - it's the opportunity to call this beautiful country our home. Happy birthday, dear Latvia!🇱🇻 https://t.co/DlfVB0Yh4d
Thank you for participating! Most of you (68%) got the answer right. Our special aircraft with Latvian flag livery made its debut in 2018. ✈️ Have a wonderful and safe week! https://t.co/dcdkyRycKU

As Latvia’s birthday week is approaching, on this #airBalticQuiz we would like to test your knowledge about our fleet. Do you know which year our special aircraft with Latvian flag livery made its first debut? 🇱🇻✈️

Creating a menu is a very interesting process! #DidYouKnow that in result of altitude pressure person's senses of taste change? Knowing this, the chefs who are creating a new menu also take the flight, so they could fully taste the food that they will provide for passengers. https://t.co/LysEcnQczR

Landings in a new airport are always very exciting! Thank you @berlinairport for the warm welcome! #helloBER 

📷 by Flughafen Berlin Brandenburg, Thomas Kierok https://t.co/rO1qaj14sQ

Good morning! ☀ This time most of you (73%) got the right answer - the airport code for the new Berlin Brandenburg Airport (@berlinairport) is BER! ✈️ See you in our flights there and have a safe and wonderful week!
An exciting new journey has begun - #helloBer! We are happy to announce that as of November 8, airBaltic will take you to a new airport in Berlin - @berlinairport! https://t.co/0MeYoGnJZB

Today we performed our last flight from Berlin Tegel Airport (TXL) to @riga_airport. Thanks to our partners for the great cooperation we’ve had throughout these years! Looking forward to many happy take-offs and landings in the new @berlinairport (BER)! https://t.co/dlRpM0CTEf

data.text: Are you ready for our weekly #airBalticQuiz? On November 8 we will start our flights to the new Berlin Brandenburg airport!✈️🇩🇪Do you know the airport code of the mentioned airport?🤔

Another Wednesday with some facts! #DidYouKnow that each pilot is qualified for respective seat on the aircraft? Captain is qualified to operate only from the left seat, while First officer - from the right seat. For training purposes Captain could be qualified for both seats. https://t.co/a62HXFIaKJ

We are very proud of our CEO @Gaussm who has successfully completed his training course, becoming the first airline CEO in the world to have performed type rating on the @Airbus A220. https://t.co/GI1KHVD2yq

We have scheduled special flights on November 3 and November 5 from Tbilisi to Riga and vice versa. It is possible to book tickets for these flights via special phone line. More details: https://t.co/yn8RnyattD https://t.co/vobdiufnCq

airBaltic 3. un 5. novembrī veiks īpašos lidojumus no Tbilisi uz Rīgu un atpakaļ. Rezervēt biļetes iespējams, zvanot uz īpašo tālruņa līniju. Sīkākas detaļas: https://t.co/p8BHBD57Yh https://t.co/KQiC2UMS3b

Good morning! Thanks to everyone who participated in our quiz! This time most of you (43%) guessed right - airBaltic was the world’s first airline to sell cars on board. 🚗🚘
Have a wonderful week!

Another week is coming to an end and it’s #airBalticQuiz time! During these 25 years airBaltic has reached many milestones. airBaltic was the world’s first airline to sell very extravagant product on board the flights. 🤩 Can you guess the product type? 🤔

Last year we participated in Airbus A220 tour around the Pacific Region! #DidYouKnow that during this tour we visited nine destinations in seven countries? The aircraft showcasing was performed in Australia, New Zealand, New Caledonia, Papua New Guinea, Cambodia and India. https://t.co/JRhtOtiWaD

data.text: Thanks for participating in our weekly quiz! This time only 26% of you got the answer right. The total length of snowmobile routes in Kittila is 900 km. You can book flights to Kittila now via our web page and experience the winter adventure yourself! ❄⛄ https://t.co/wQMnzzp7UZ

A very cozy autumn day here in Riga and it’s time for #airBalticQuiz! This week we announced new safe winter destination – Kittila. Can you guess the total length of snowmobile routes in the municipality of Kittila? ⛷️

Last year, we were very proud to welcome our 21st A220-300 - the 100th manufactured @Airbus aircraft of this type. And now this aircraft has a special design! If you've already spotted it, share your photo with us! https://t.co/KCoSKJAxil
